list_definition.definition: (a room containing) a receptacle for the body’s waste matter, usually with a supply of water for washing this away; a lavatory

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Do you want to go to the toilet?

list_ex_of_english: What's the difference between "toilet paper" and "paper toilet"?
All the toilets were furnished with marble walls and floorings.
Almost everything, from going to the toilet to sticking stars on a picture was supervised by an adult.
The inmates also still used worn-out buckets as toilets.
There are m packages and only one toilet.
His final curtain call was the tumble he took off his toilet, naked and with the hypodermic needle still stuck in his arm.
A lime-slaked hole in the ground served as a toilet.
The severity scores ranged from ' 0 ' (no personal care disability) to ' 11 ' (cannot feed themselves or go to the toilet without help).
